title: The Vanished Vase
setting: Hartwell Museum of Antiquities, Greek wing, Wednesday 8 AM
premise: A 2,400-year-old Athenian red-figure vase disappeared from its sealed display case overnight. The case's electronic lock was opened at 11:47 PM using a staff keycard. Security footage from the Greek wing was conveniently erased.

suspects.name: Dr. Evelyn Cross
suspects.motive: Facing pressure to deaccession pieces to fund building renovations and wanted leverage over the board
suspects.alibi: I left the museum at 6 PM and drove straight to the Faculty Club dinner downtown. I was there from 7 PM until past midnight with six colleagues.

suspects.name: Marco Sifuentes
suspects.motive: Deeply in debt from gambling and was recently seen meeting a known antiquities fence
suspects.alibi: I was on the night shift Tuesday but only covering the east wing. I clocked in at 10 PM and stayed at the east wing desk all night reviewing camera feeds.

suspects.name: Helen Yardley
suspects.motive: Believes the vase is being damaged by poor climate controls and has petitioned to have it moved
suspects.alibi: I worked late in the conservation lab until about 9 PM. Then I took the crosstown bus home. My transit card shows I tapped out at the Vine Street stop at 9:35 PM.

suspects.name: Jonas Prichard
suspects.motive: Wants to replace permanent displays with traveling shows to boost attendance numbers
suspects.alibi: I left work at 5:30 PM and went to my apartment. I ordered delivery at 8 PM and watched television all evening. I never returned to the museum Tuesday night.

clues.title: Keycard Access Log
clues.content: The electronic lock on the Greek wing display case was opened at 11:47 PM using keycard #0041, which is assigned to Jonas Prichard. Only four staff keycards can open that case.

clues.title: Lobby Camera Footage
clues.content: The lobby cameras were not erased. They show someone entering through the staff entrance at 11:30 PM and leaving at 12:15 AM carrying a large padded bag. The figure matches Jonas's height and build.

clues.title: Delivery App Records
clues.content: Jonas's delivery order was placed at 8:02 PM and marked delivered at 8:31 PM. But the driver's GPS log shows the food was left at the door with no answer after three knocks -- Jonas was not home when it arrived.

hints.text: Pay close attention to each suspect's account of where they were during the late evening hours.
If someone ordered food delivery, would they necessarily be there when it arrived?
